tweets.text:
We have some repair tests lined up for tomorrow. We will repair 2 damages, 1 with rock bags and 1 with a clay solution. We can't wait!
#climateadaptation #floodprotection #emergencyrepair #research Thx @Rijkswaterstaat @EnvAgency @STOWAwater @Defensie @Vlaamsewaterweg @waterschap https://t.co/r15XtPVZsQ

@Polder2Cs @Rijkswaterstaat @EnvAgency @STOWAwater @Defensie @Vlaamsewaterweg @waterschap This is  one of the critical experiments that define the safety of millions of people life. Well done guys. Keep on inspiring us. https://t.co/KP1l6mqmxK

'ZERO is the ONLY acceptable rate of fly-tipping'.

Prof Margaret Bates @Wastereader in @BBCPanorama 'Rubbish Dump Britain'. See it on @BBCiPlayer

Tackling #flytipping needs resources, intelligence & enforcement.

@EnvAgency @EmmaViner @ESA_tweets @CIWM @CPRE @NFUtweets @ADEPTLA https://t.co/FBgN9dbwbY

tweets.text:
@EnvAgencyMids @BBCRadioStoke @Sotlive Residents of Newcastle under Lyme, yet again, this morning, woke up to the vile horrendous stench that emits from Whalleys quarry into their homes.
People are becoming frustrated as this has been going on for far too long & is getting worse.

Attention anglers, the new #FishingLicence images have launched! 

Get set to relax in nature. Buy your new fishing licence at: https://t.co/fx56eQlGOg https://t.co/4fHZRib9Z7

Beautiful day for a drone flyover at Smardale where last year we planted 800 trees in the floodplain for a Natural Flood Management (#NFM) project. Thanks to funding from @EnvAgencyNW and @westmorlanddale https://t.co/bpNx2xawfY

tweets.text: @WarOnWasteNZ That‚Äôs a great way of putting it. Locally to me the powers that be think ‚Äúsky-fill‚Äù is the solution to waste. Europe‚Äôs largest waste incinerator has just been given the permit it requires to be built and operate - by our @EnvAgency - on my doorstep

urls.title: Youth Voice Summit - Rethinking Water
urls.description: A chance for you to input your opinions and experiences on future water management and how you would like to engage in giving your opinion in the decisions made by the Environment Agency in the future.

tweets.text:
Join us for Youth Voice Summit: Rethinking Water! We have teamed up with @EnvAgency and would like to know young people‚Äôs opinions on future water management, youth engagement and future governance.

Find out more and sign up here üëá
https://t.co/Gmx3uHGWJI https://t.co/PaINXRqdcE

"The Green Industrial Revolution needs strong Green Industrial Regulation." Read the full speech from @EmmaHowardBoyd, Chair of @EnvAgency, our keynote speaker at today's event - outlining how good #regulation delivers #innovation, opportunity and fairness
https://t.co/RMkBIk184z

Great to see frogspawn where we have worked hard clearing willow self seeds from encroaching some of our ponds. We have also been clearing self seeds from some the islands at the Kersal wetlands & put on some straw bales to encourage nesting wildfowl & waders @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/v9GgzhgC6K

Sandbags ‚Äì more used to keeping out floodwater ‚Äì help secure the Bath racecourse Covid-19 vaccination centre.  We took along more than 140 sandbags to help fix the tent in position. #partnership @AvonFireRescue https://t.co/7MKPj1znP9

tweets.text: The vertical sector gates are heading to the paint workshop in sunny Holland today via self-propelled modular transporter. They'll be painted with a technical coating which will ensure they have sufficient corrosion protection upon installation at the #BostonBarrier site. https://t.co/vck7QyH0To

Last week our Lower Hull Field Team deployed a floating retention boom in the Broomfleet area.

They have been working with our Environment Management Team and have deployed the booms to contain a kerosene spill so it does not move further downstream. https://t.co/iExZ1I6Gmj

Slowly but surely we are removing pennywort from the Witham Catchment near Lincoln with @LionsEnv and support from @EnvAgencyMids . These before and after images are from the Catchwater Drain. If not removed it will quickly cover the channel.  https://t.co/RdefffRrBG https://t.co/elgVl5dTK9

READ how our recent prosecution of @thameswater was covered by @berkshire_live‚Ä¶

ICYMI‚Ä¶ A judge fined them ¬£2.3m for polluting a stream at #Henley https://t.co/FbMwxjtuDp
Another find at low water last night - a very glassy elver at Lee-on-the-Solent @TimSykesEA @EnvAgency @SouthernIFCA @HantsIWWildlife https://t.co/EssIbMRnCR

Some hefty #NFM leaky dams being built at @Whinlatter - today was a beautiful day ‚òÄÔ∏è for some log winching with @WestCumbriaRT @EnvAgencyNW @ForestryEngland & contractors Eden Treescapes. The tractor üöú looks tiny compared to the dams! https://t.co/lLsaYfUkvB

#Panorama on #flytipping last night - good overview of this increasing problem. I thought @EnvAgency responses were weak and typically lacking in any real action. Why after >10 years of problems is it getting worse not better? Why is the carriers reg system still totally useless?
This is a big part of Britain‚Äôs litter problem.  Chronic lack of enforcement of laws by @EnvAgency and @HighwaysEngland @BBCJustinR https://t.co/Qv6ISawY9f

Can you help us in our fight against #WasteCrime? 

We've launched a Waste Crime Survey to help us build a better intelligence picture across the country. 

Your responses will be kept confidential and anonymous. 

Complete the survey here: https://t.co/THxMyWjzgX https://t.co/2s6TGQONnn
@PlanAbby @EnvAgency @TE2100Plan Congratulations and good luck
The Team are working with the polluter to ensure the oil is recovered from the watercourse to prevent further environmental damage to the wildlife and surrounding habitats. https://t.co/3yp9PbuPpb

As hosts of #COP26, we're committed to protecting and restoring our natural environment.

We're working #TogetherForOurPlanet with @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm and others to deliver the Nature Recovery Network and create better connected spaces for nature üåø https://t.co/8WXeqhXwOQ

Officers in #Lancashire have been working with @prestoncouncil today applying Siltex to Haslam Park, Barley Pit & Tom Benson Way pond.

Siltex is used to decrease organic & oxidisable matter which results in a reduction of silt build up in & ponds is harmless to aquatic life. https://t.co/fj9Kzu9oLU

A Devon businessman has been told to to spend ¬£85,344 of his own money to remove waste he illegally deposited on a floodplain near Cullompton.
https://t.co/SUaL5Gj324

Excellent session of #Warwickshire Rural Crime Partnership hosted by @WarwickshirePCC highlighted activity to prevent & investigate #agricultural #waste #wildlife & #HeritageCrime @RuralCrimeCops @NFUCountryside @EnvAgencyMids @HistoricEngland @HE_Midlands @WKWT @WarksFireRescue https://t.co/sELmeuE9C0

urls.title: Whinlatter Forest dam project to combat floods
urls.description: Made from logs, the dams in Whinlatter Forest are set to reduce peak river levels downstream.

tweets.text: In the end a result. I do have some sympathy for @EnvAgency, when processes take over 5 years to resolve how can we ever keep up with the cowboys? #wastecrime https://t.co/vPQE1IJVUv

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Then what is the point of calling it the ENVIRONMENTAL agency? What is the point of the agency at all? This is disgraceful. Rivers should not be used as open sewers. Utterly disgusting. I‚Äôm appalled. ü§¨ü§¨ü§¨ü§¨ü§Æü§Æü§Æü§Æü§Æ
@PJennings88 @RiverChess @EnvAgency The @EnvAgency that has facilitated this sort of pollution for so many years that it doesn't know what to do now that it has been rumbled?

Nice words but for years the @EnvAgency has been deregulating by the back door through its policy of prosecuting only a fraction and deliberately under-resourcing its responders to make them ineffective. @RachSalv @Feargal_Sharkey https://t.co/jz60BCRXqF
@ShrewsburyTC @ball_helen @EnvAgency @SFejfer

If you're based in, or working with a company in the #SouthWest then this is your chance to apply! @WRcplc @RSKGroup @wessexwater @SouthWestWater @PennonGroup @BristolWater @EnvAgency https://t.co/7RKydJRHVz

The UK's 2nd largest refinery, Essar Oil's Stanlow facility, had the worst possible rating of compliance with its environmental permit in 2019. It therefore paid out triple the usual annual fee to the @EnvAgency last year - more than ¬£800k, I reckon. https://t.co/SmXplY0Fne

tweets.text: Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa

Fun morning @Whinlatter speaking to @timbackshallitv about our 200 leaky dams that will slow the flow towards Lorton. Look out for us on your telly in the coming days! #WEG @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/QMOxkRKxmP

The @EnvAgency review of its #ThamesEstuary2100 plan found: sea level rise accelerated over the last few decades; 97.5% of the tidal flood defences are meeting or exceeding target condition; more frequent Thames Barrier closures will be needed https://t.co/BrVaC0EIzv https://t.co/GYfPLRwQ6X

Breaking: @thameswater fined ¬£2.3m, with costs of nearly ¬£90,000 for ‚Äúentirely foreseeable‚Äù #pollution.

More than 1,100 fish died when equipment failures released sewage into 2 streams at Henley in 2016.
Please report suspected pollution in rivers and streams to us: 0800 807060 https://t.co/cIwVfJmJ8q
